google_reviews.author: Colton Davis
google_reviews.review:
While Real Property Management might seem like a convenient choice for renting, my experience with them has been less than satisfactory.

Let me start with the move-out process, which was a nightmare. Expect to jump through hoops and incur unexpected expenses. Despite leaving the apartment in decent condition, I was hit with charges for what should be considered normal wear and tear. Nail holes in the wall, interior painting, and light bulb replacements were all on the list of things I was charged for. It felt like they were searching for any excuse to dip into my deposit. The most absurd part? Being forced to hire a professional cleaning company at my own expense.

Speaking of deposits, be prepared to say goodbye to a chunk of yours for a suspicious $200 admin fee. Apparently, coordinating move-out work that was supposedly my responsibility warranted this hefty deduction. And let's not forget the exorbitant charges for seemingly minor items. $284 for a freezer shelf? $77 for a gallon of paint? Absolutely ridiculous.

What's more, their strict subleasing policy is downright exploitative. Want to sublease? Sure, but only if you're willing to fork over three months' rent. It's a blatant cash grab and shows a complete lack of consideration for renters.

Overall, Real Property Management seems more interested in nickel and diming tenants than providing a fair and transparent renting experience. If I had known about their overly scrutinous move-out process beforehand, I would have meticulously documented every detail on the move-in inspection form. Consider yourself warnedrenters, beware.

ownerResponse.text:
We appreciate your feedback and take it seriously. At Real Property Management, we strive to provide a fair renting experience.
Regarding the move-out process, charges for items like excessive nail holes, tenant damage that requires painting, and burnt out light bulbs are outlined in the Lease Agreement, and are standard for maintaining the property's condition.
The admin fee for coordinating maintenance for tenant damage upon move-out is also standard and communicated upfront in the Lease Agreement.
Our subleasing policy is firm to ensure compliance with leasing regulations and protect both tenants and property owners.
We're sorry our processes didn't meet your expectations, though they were explained at lease signing and detailed in the lease. Thanks for your feedback and bringing your concerns to our attention.

google_reviews.author: Lindsey Price
google_reviews.review:
Future tenants should be aware that RPM puts their landlords above their tenants and are only interested in making money, not supporting the tenants. In a disagreement of the use of my security deposit, Gail was rude and unhelpful and because we couldnt agree, now I have to take an extra step and file a lawsuit just to get my deposit back. Gail repeatedly said the house was dirty to be rude rather than using any level of professionalism or customer service. She also offered no avenue to dispute the charge other than continuously saying this is how it must be instead of understanding its a mutual disagreement and we could use a mediator to resolve it. Why not clarify that its well within a tenant rights to dispute the charges? Im unsure if Gail is incapable or just unwilling to read the laws laid out to protect Washington state tenants.

I understand needing to leave the house in a certain condition based on our lease agreement but was being rude necessary? We are poor and we did our best, we couldnt afford the cleaners they wanted. We work full time and go to school full time, I couldnt spend more than a month deep cleaning the house to meet RPM needs. I recognize they want the house in a certain way and we didnt meet that standard but at this point and based on Gails attitude, I just feel totally scammed no matter what they say is wrong with the house because anything I say will just be met with this is how it must be done. In my opinion, forcing your tenants to perfect the home to your standard out of pocket is just taking advantage of renters who often dont have a choice about the fact they are renting.  Its unfortunate that RPM  doesnt do any work themselves and expects the previous tenant to perfect the house out of pocket for the next tenant, continuing to limit any work needed on RPM side and keeping them from having to bother investing in their properties and tenants.

I also find it extremely important to mention that we returned the house in the exact position it came in when we got it minus regular wear and tear from living in a 100+ year old house for 2 years. It was equally as dirty when we moved in, I spent 2 years deep scrubbing the dirty off of everything in the home (pictures below).

Some advice for RPM, maybe try caring about your tenants and properties by cleaning them yourself rather than being lazy and judgmental? Maybe also have a pre written email ready for tenant deposit disputes since you are not able to talk them through as a company in a nice and professional way. Regardless of their reasoning for taking some or all of my deposit, I just hope future tenants dont make the same mistakes I did and spend 2 months cleaning the house and scrubbing every inch to perfection and most importantly, have Gail walk through your house before you move out so its harder to get taken advantage of - otherwise they do the walkthrough alone and make their own decisions.

I also have a strong feeling based on their previous negative reviews that they will respond to this unprofessionally too. I dont care about the deposit or them, I just want other tenants to be protected and not make the same mistakes I did by renting through them.

ownerResponse.text:
We're sorry to hear about your experience. At Real Property Management, we prioritize professionalism and aim to provide excellent service to landlords and tenants alike. We strictly adhere to Tenant Landlord Law and take it seriously. Pet urine in carpet and along baseboards isn't considered normal wear and tear and must be addressed.

Regarding security deposit disputes, we follow Washington state laws and guidelines. We understand disagreements may arise and always aim for honesty and fairness to both tenants and owners.

Your feedback is important to us, and we're dedicated to improving our services. We apologize for any perceived rudeness, which doesn't reflect our customer service standards.

google_reviews.author: Rick Tilton
google_reviews.review:
Exceptional Property Management Experience with Real Property Management North Puget Sound.

I recently had the pleasure of working with Frank Volkert and the team at Real Property Management North Puget Sound (RPMNPS) to handle the marketing, tenant screening, and overall management of my property. From our initial meeting to the successful one-year rental period, I couldn't be more satisfied with their services.

One of the standout aspects of RPMNPS is their commitment to ensuring the property is in optimal condition for attracting quality tenants. Frank Volkert, in particular, demonstrated a keen understanding of the market and provided valuable suggestions to enhance my property's appeal. His recommendations for painting and new floor coverings proved to be instrumental in attracting a pool of applicants.

The meticulous move-in inspection conducted by RPMNPS's home inspector set the tone for the professional standards upheld by the company. It was reassuring to know that they took the time to thoroughly assess the property before tenants moved in. Equally commendable was the follow-up inspection after six months, demonstrating their commitment to maintaining the property's condition over the long term.

Throughout the process, Frank displayed excellent communication and negotiation skills. From the moment the property was ready, he promptly presented a range of qualified applicants, allowing us to make an informed decision. This proactive approach ensured a seamless transition from property preparation to successful tenant placement.

I appreciate the transparency and efficiency demonstrated by RPMNPS. Frank and his team's dedication to maximizing rental returns and ensuring tenant satisfaction have resulted in a trouble-free rental experience for the past year. I am grateful for their expertise and highly recommend Real Property Management Group Northwest to anyone seeking reliable and effective property management services.

In conclusion, my experience with RPMNPS has been nothing short of outstanding, and I am confident in their ability to continue delivering top-notch property management services in the future. Thank you, Frank Volkert, and the entire team at RPMNPS, for your professionalism, attention to detail, and commitment to excellence.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you, Rick Tilton, for your exceptional review of our property management services at Real Property Management North Puget Sound! We are grateful for your trust and appreciate your kind words about Frank Volkert and our team. Your satisfaction and positive experience over the past year mean a lot to us. We will continue to deliver top-notch property management services with professionalism, attention to detail, and a commitment to excellence. Thank you again for your recommendation!

google_reviews.author: Ley Daffodil
google_reviews.review:
I cant say anything good about this property management. Moved into a very dirty (but surfaced cleaned, so couldnt tell until actually moving in), poorly taken care of home. Had many issues throughout the stay. Countless emails and complaints. Never were they taken care of. Had inspector come in every 6 months and would tell us every time that their notes and pictures were sent to property owner. And that most of the issues were ongoing before moving in. The stairs/porch/and back patio were unsafe and rotting.
I understand these are issues that the property owner should have taken care of. But with no help from the property management, we got no where to fix the issues.
Many times random employees would call or email to ask about lists of things needing to be done without investigating or checking with other employees who have already been made aware of issues. It was a constant cat and mouse game with this property management. It seemed like no one communicated within the office. And nothing was ever taken serious.
One night a pipe busted in our bathroom gushing hot water. For hours we couldn't get it to stop. We called the emergency line left a message. No one called back until the morning. Imagine if we didn't figure that out how high our bill would have been or how damaged the house could have gotten.
The fridge when we moved in was broken with missing drawers and shelves.
I don't know how property management could let this home get so bad and not do their due diligence with the owners to fix these terrible issues.

I've since moved out of state. But had I not, I would definitely steered clear of this management company again.

ownerResponse.text: We apologize for the experience you had with our property management. We understand your frustration with the cleanliness and maintenance issues you encountered during your stay. We strive to provide a well-maintained living environment for all our tenants and we apologize for falling short in this instance. We apologize for any miscommunication or lack of promptness in addressing your concerns. Please know that we take these matters seriously and we appreciate your feedback. If you have any further concerns or need assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out to us via call or text.

google_reviews.author: Suhas Manangi
google_reviews.review: Horrible company and horrible service. I signed up in Sept 2022, paid them 30% of rent in onboarding fees but they did not onboard tenants till late Oct, and didn't collect rent from one tenant for so long that led to eviction. Did the same with another tenant. Lost over 1 year of rents. They charged higher than market prices for placing tenants but below par services. Highly unresponsive management company. I terminated after one year for not meeting quality of service for which they sent a large retailiatory bogus bills. Unprofessional and stay away from them.

ownerResponse.text:
Suhas, we work very hard for our clients and did our very best in the situation you asked us to help you with.  This a description of what happened.           
Last year, when you first reached out to us about managing your 4-plex with existing tenants. We started management of units AB&D on 9/19/2022 and Unit C on 9/6/2022.  Unit A had 2 tenant's you had placed previously, that already were not paying you rent, we agreed to help you either get them to pay rent or get them to move on which we did. We got the tenants to vacate in Unit A on 11/30/22. They had trashed your rental so we facilitated a full renovation on Unit A to get it ready for the market by 12/27/2022 and got you new tenants for Unit A by 2/2/2023, this all during the slowest time of year for the rental market. Unit B was also a tenant you had placed before we started managing. She paid October 2022 rent, because of financial/emotional issues, she was not able to pay rent after that so we connected her with Volunteers of America and walked her through the process of applying for rental assistance. VoA assisted in helping her catch up with $5952.50 in rental assistance while she was paying what she could afford each month. However, she eventually stopped paying all-together and didn't apply for more assistance. She was evicted through legal process on 9/14/2023.  Unit 3 and 4 were also tenants you had found that we managed. They have been ideal tenants. Unit 3 & 4 have paid rent through the duration of our contract together. We worked diligently on the situation we were given and it's unfortunate that WA State Landlord Tenant Law mandates take longer than we all would have liked. Regarding the termination fees without proper notice as agreed to in the Management Contract. We discussed this with you and you wanted to terminate without proper notice regardless.

I'm an investor in multiple states and it matters to me that the property manager also understands the investor mindset and will focus on managing my rentals not busy doing a whole lot of nothing.  Frank  & Daniel - thanks for taking the time to speak with me.

Happened to be on Zillow and having fallen victim of scam 2x through Zillow- I saw our new place listed on Zillow, first thing that struck my mind was to scroll down the listing page, check out who made the listing as I wasnt going to move forward if it was listed by an individual but surprisingly it wasnt. I copied the name of the company to browser which sourced them out, I clicked on their website only to find the listing and many more houses listed for rent. That right there gave me a little hope as a start. I scheduled viewing for the next day and I must say RPM team over at Marysville WA, are all phenomenal. Things went too fast and in two weeks we are officially in our new rented place. All thanks to Rep Cynthia & Rose for helping to make the entire process worthwhile and smooth for us. Gods speed of blessings ladies. PS: I have referred two of our family friends for your service.

google_reviews.review: When I decided to enter the real estate investment game about three years ago, my spouse said OK, but only if I promised to hire a property management company. Not only was their pricing good, but they offered services and expertise from both their own collective experience and the knowledge (industry, financial, legal) provided from RPM's company headquarters.  They are a family-owned office that operates with integrity and good customer service - for owners and tenants.  I have always been able to call with questions and get advice over the phone, email or even on site at the property.  We have always worked through any issue together.  For example, the staff in Everett helped me to make decisions about how to best remodel my first property to maximize the rent I could receive and to lower the amount of future repairs and maintenance requirements.  This is knowledge I've applied to other remodels and purchases.  Now that I'm up to a handful of properties, RPM has helped me as a partner the whole way.  They are a critical part of the team I count on in RE investing along with my bankers, RE mentor, legal and insurance.  Knowing RPM is in my corner has been key in having the confidence to keep looking for more investments.  Obviously, I highly recommend Real Property Management - North Puget Sound!

google_reviews.author: Jennifer B.
google_reviews.review:
When looking for a rental home in Snohomish County, I was very careful to evaluate rental management companies. I have heard horror stories and experienced one with my last rental property manager. So, when I found a house managed by RPM, I examined Real Property Management Puget Sound closely and found them to be professional, courteous, and timely in their responses. I decided that they were a property management company that I could work with.

Amy Hammer was our leasing agent and she was incredibly friendly and helpful. She walked us through the lease and the requirements before we signed.

On a scale of 1-5, I would give RPM a 4 (5 being stellar and no way to improve, 1 being "don't ever work with them"). The leasing process was smooth and Amy was available to answer any questions/concerns via email. She was very timely in her responses and addressed our concerns and questions well. We have had to put in a few maintenance requests and RPM was always prompt with addressing the requests. The problems we had were with the third party vendors who would often not return RPM's calls. But, that does not reflect on RPM.

Real Property Management exceeded my expectations as far as tenant privacy and autonomy. While there are quarterly walk-throughs, RPM is not overly demanding or intrusive as other property management companies can be.

One area to improve would be to communicate after a maintenance request has been completed. Two of our maintenance requests are still pending as (I assume, I haven't received communication about them) they are in the process of ordering replacement parts for a light fixture and a refrigerator. Followup emails as to what the plan is would be incredibly helpful.

Overall, I would not hesitate recommending RPM to someone looking to rent a home.

google_reviews.author: Office Manager
google_reviews.review: As an employee of Morgan Maintenance Services, I work closely with Rose Morrison, the Maintenance Coordinator for RPM. Rose and her staff are professional, friendly and efficient. They respond to phone calls and emails quickly and work with us to be flexible when scheduling. As one of their preferred vendors, they always provide us with detailed info so our crew goes into a job prepared. I would highly recommend them!

google_reviews.author: Casey Westerman
google_reviews.review:
I've been a landlord and a tenant.  If you're a landlord - this company is solid.  If you're a tenant - I'd stay away from properties managed by this company.  I'll try to keep this short, despite having a lot to say.  To be transparent, I'm writing this review as a tenant, since that was my interaction with RPM.
Move-in and the checklist took over an hour and a half!  Longest I've experienced as a tenant.  I called their emergency line because there was water under the fridge that continued to appear after wiping it up.  It took them 2 days to get back to me.  Other than that, all was good during our short (3-4 month) lease.  The real headaches came when it was time to terminate our lease early - we paid the steep early termination penalty (which I don't have a problem with, it was a part of the contract and I'm a reasonable person).  They advised when we moved in that we would have to use "one of (their) approved vendors" for both the move-out cleaning and carpet cleaning.  This is where the biggest frustration with RPM lays - RPM only had a single vendor for both.  I had no choice at all for who we used.  See my separate review of the cleaning company, Morgan Real Estate Management.  I was at the mercy of those vendors for what they wanted to charge for their services.
I understand that RPM is working to protect the owner of the rental property.  However, from a tenant perspective, you're going to pay on the backend of your rental.  Personally, I'd stay away from them as a tenant in the future - they aren't reasonable when it comes to services at move-out.

google_reviews.review: These folks have been great to work with.  Responsive and reliable, they are professional and worked hard to help me get my house rented.  Its a great service at a reasonable price.  I shopped around, they give the best value for the money!  They have innovative value added technology and services to keep you informed,account for your funds and protect you from loss.   They also call you back.

I tried to contact them about a move-out I was sent to 5 different people.  Once I got a hold of someone they were not willing to help me.  Beware current tenant when you move-out they shut all of your portals so you can't get any documentation for work order or items requested for repair.  Oh and don't ask for a copy of any receipt because they won't provide you with one, calling it Privacy with their Vendors.  I have worked in the Property Management business for 35 years and I have never seen such poor management in my life.  So glad that my son now rents through another company.  Owners beware there are a lot more option out their for you.

google_reviews.author: nelstheviking
google_reviews.review: We used this company to manage our house, and had many bad experiences. They were always extremely difficult to get a hold of and wouldn't answer or return calls or get back to us with information we wanted. At times they charged us exorbitant maintenance fees and wouldn't say what those fees were actually for. Despite having a requirement to call us before spending more than $300 on maintenance they would do it anyway and we would only know when we got the bill. When we had a tenant that stopped paying rent and needed to be evicted they took care of the eviction process, but did nothing to keep us informed of what was happening and never provided sufficient information for us to pursue losses in small claims, despite asking for such information dozens of times.

ownerResponse.text:
Nels, thank you for your feedback regarding the rental property we have been managing for you for over 3 years.  RPM takes this kind of feedback very seriously and will be reaching out to you to resolve your concerns. At RPM we always get back to clients and tenants within 24 hours of any phone call or email correspondence. We are transparent on our maintenance fees and offer fair yet competitive repair estimates and prices. A detailed description of all maintenance work performed is found on your monthly online statements. In reviewing the repair history at your property I see a couple of emergency water leaks that were fixed expeditiously to prevent further property damage. As your property manager, I assure you, prevention of further damage to your property that water leaks can so easily cause, was our top priority through those repairs. Our communication history shows we kept you posted through the entirety of the emergency water leak repair process. One of those bills was over the $300 pre-approved amount, we informed you and received permission from you to do the work. However, our management contract grants us the authority to act in your best interest in the case of emergency situations such as water, fire, flood, etc.

Regarding the eviction of the tenant that stopped paying rent. Unfortunately, once the lease was signed, we later found out the approved tenant did not move in but instead had moved in his adult daughter, that would not have qualified.  Shortly after the lease started we discovered this and then the rent stopped coming in so we started the eviction process. We walked you through every step of the way. Once the Writ of Restitution was performed, we were at the property per your request when the Sheriff physically removed the resident. Our team here at RPM then removed all the residents property (couches, bed frames, mattresses, dishes etc) from inside the house onto the lawn. We updated you with photos. We would be happy to discuss this further. Thank you.

google_reviews.author: Liz Donadio
google_reviews.review: The lack of responsiveness and professionalism demonstrated by this company, particularly Gail Volkert is unprecedented in my experience. At every opportunity to be of service to me as a property owner, they deferred to my tenant who vandalized my property and left me with several messes, including an infestation in my crawlspace that was never noted or dealt with by RPMNPS. Gail received the final water/sewer bill for $224. and did not attempt to recover from tenant, but rather claimed that I am responsible for this weeks after the fact. This is beyond subpar service and I would not recommend ever doing business with them.

ownerResponse.text: I am sorry you feel this way. We don't have control what a tenant does under certain circumstances. Please contact us so we have a chance to look at all the facts. If we have wronged you, we want to make it right.

That peace of mind alone makes me so happy I decided to go with RPM.  If Adam's boss is reading this, give that man a raise.  He went way above and beyond anything I could have ever hoped for.  I hope this will be a very long relationship between me and RPM.  Thanks for everything!

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the feedback.  We are sorry our interaction was not a positive one. Our role was limited to helping with preparing the property for move-in and tenant placement only. summary.text:
Good

Real Property Management North Puget Sound (RPMNPS) appears to excel in professionalism and responsiveness, with tenants noting prompt and efficient service in addressing maintenance requests and issues. Staff members, including Terry, have been praised for their unwavering support and dedication to ensuring a comfortable tenant experience. Customers appreciate RPMNPS for its communicative approach, with some highlighting the company's ability to relieve the stress associated with property management. Examples of particular employees who have garnered individual accolades for their assistance include Joseph Butcher for his attention to detail and problem-solving skills, as well as Rose and Cynthia for their help with the move-in process.

Great

The RPMNPS team is described as caring, with customers feeling that their needs are genuinely considered. Tenants have mentioned the convenience of the company's online systems for rent payment and maintenance requests. Additionally, the company has been commended for expert advice on property value and investment insights, emphasizing their value to property owners. The kindness and helpfulness of RPM employees during the application and leasing processes, as well as during occupancy, have consistently been a theme in the positive reviews.

Bad

Some tenants have encountered less than satisfactory experiences with RPMNPS. There have been instances of delayed responses and perceived inadequacies in communication, particularly when trying to view or inquire about properties. Maintenance issues have sometimes not been resolved to the satisfaction of tenants, and challenges have also arisen during the move-out process, where tenants had trouble receiving assistance or clarification from staff.

Ugly

The company's handling of security deposits and move-out charges has come under fire, with tenants expressing frustration over unexpected fees and charges for what tenants believe should have been considered normal wear and tear. Accusations of mismanagement have arisen, with some former tenants suggesting that RPMNPS displayed a lack of professionalism and fairness. In these cases, it seems that regardless of the company's positive aspects, the experiences of certain tenants have tainted their overall perception of the property management company.
